LLM.title: Categories of Inference-Time Scaling for Improved LLM Reasoning
LLM.summary: Inference scaling has become one of the most effective ways to improve answer quality and accuracy in deployed LLMs. The idea is straightforward. If we are willing to spend a bit more compute, and more time at inference time (when we use the model to generate text), we can get the model to produce better answers.

LLM.summary: A 2025 review of large language models, from DeepSeek R1 and RLVR to inference-time scaling, benchmarks, architectures, and predictions for 2026.

LLM.title: LLM Research Papers: The 2025 List (July to December)
LLM.summary: A curated list of LLM research papers from July–December 2025, organized by reasoning models, inference-time scaling, architectures, training efficiency, and diffusion.
